item.title: check if password has been compromised
item.description: 13:18 Thursday 08 November 2018 JST I wanted to write a Bash script which would take a file with a list of passwords and throw each one at Troy Hunt’s collection of compromised passwords. I probably won’t do it soon because I found a bash one-liner which checks to see if a password was compromised. I had to modify it slightly, but this line works on my Mac: echo "pass> "; read -s pass_str; sha1=$(echo -n $pass_str | tr -d '\n' | shasum); echo "Hash prefix: ${sha1:0:5}"; echo "Hash suffix: ${sha1:5:35}"; result=$(curl https://api.
